title: Gary Cohn-Backed Smartphone Maker Hoyos Integrity Files for Bankruptcy; The Fort Lauderdale, Fla., company listed liabilities of $10 million to $50 million
text:
Founded in 2016, Hoyos has said it acquired intellectual property behind Nextel Communications Inc. and Motorola Mobility LLC technology, and that its phones were designed by teams that used to work for Motorola. Hoyos has said the secured operating system is made by Santa Barbara, Calif.-based Green Hills Software.

Hoyos also has been a developer of a biometrically secure digital wallet that it said can hold any cryptocurrency. In late 2019, Hoyos and insurer AXA XL struck a deal where Hoyos would reimburse a Hoyos Wallet user up to $1 million through coverage from AXA XL in the event of hacking.

Mr. Cohn, a former top economic adviser to President Donald Trump and former president of Goldman Sachs Group Inc., joined Hoyos as an investor and as a member of its advisory board in late 2019. He made an investment of undisclosed size in the company through his family office. The court filing showed no corporation owns more than 10% of Hoyos stock.

Mr. Cohn is co-chairman of Cohn Robbins Holding Corp., a special-purpose acquisition company. Last year, he was appointed as vice chairman at International Business Machines Corp.

At the time Mr. Cohn joined Hoyos, the company was completing development of its own secured smartphone that it said had the same operating system that protects certain U.S. nuclear bombers.

Hoyos is represented in the chapter 11 bankruptcy by law firm Klehr Harrison Harvey Branzburg LLP. The case, number 22-10365, has been assigned to Judge Mary Walrath.
